result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Luke R Davis

records.addlTxt:
2:56 PM Defendant Luke R Davis in court.  Attorney Nicole A. Muller in court for Luke R Davis.  Attorney Shawn N Woller in court for State of Wisconsin.

Defense filed a Motion to adjourn jury trial due to discovery issues. 

Defense states that all discovery that is available, the Defense now has. 911 call was not preserved.  Defense has not been able to review all bodycamera footage. Amended offer was provided to Defense prior to today's hearing. Defense also anticipates possible motions being filed. 

Court will take off jury trial set for 10/25/2022, and set another trial date. 

Any motions to be filed by 11/18/2022.
Jury status hearing scheduled for March 30, 2023 at 10:30 am.

10:26 AM Defendant Luke R Davis appeared by Zoom with attorney Gregory W Isaac who appeared by Zoom.  Jack A. Pitzo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing.  The Court finds that the Defendant's waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.  Waive reading of Information.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED. To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key.
Hearing on February 2, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  If DNA sample has not been taken from the defendant, the Court orders sample to be taken;  and it may be expunged under 165.77(4) Wis. Statutes.  Defendant to have no contact with Victim A/Victim B/Witness A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant is not to engage in any physical discipline or corporal punishment of any child.

04:03 PM Defendant Luke R Davis in court, in custody, with attorney J Andrew Herbers.   Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant to seek counsel.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for February 2, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
